page.title: 13Recreation (2) in Mousehole
page.content: As well as the things mentioned under{Recreation (1)}there are a number of other clubs. Some of these are also associated with the{St. {Clements Methodist Chapel}such as the {Young Wives}group and the{Ladies {Sewing Guild.} These all use the Sunday School room for their meetings which as there is no village hall serves this purpose for many events not held on a regular basis. Another user of this room is the {Mousehole Male Voice Choir}which made its first radio broadcast as far back a 1932 and since then over one hundred more. In 1956 it also became the first{Cornish}male voice choir to appear on television. The choir has been very successful in many contests and has many engagements which take them all over the country as well as the regular local performances.
